eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ThirdPersonCamera
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move the camera  to look at an object from a given distance.
description: Move the camera  to look at an object from a given distance with a rotation and an elevation angles.
It can be useful for:
- 3D platformer games ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://3d-platformer))
- 3D racing games ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://3d-car-coin-hunt))
- Orbit camera controls ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://3d-tile-based-city-builder))
- Isometric-like point of view ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://3d-road-crosser))

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object. This action must be called after the object has moved for the frame.
eventsFunctions.name: MoveCameraCloser

events.comment: The camera following is called with an action, the call from doStepPreEvents must be disabled to avoid to do it twice.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object.
eventsFunctions.name: DoMoveCameraCloser

events.comment:
At each frame, the camera must catchup the target by a given ratio (speed)
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1) - targetX) * (1 - speed)

The frame rate must not impact on the catch-up speed, we don't want a speed in ratio per frame but a speed ratio per second, like this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1s) - targetX) * (1 - speed)

Ok, but we still need to process each frame, we can use a exponent for this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * (1 - speed)^timeDelta
cameraX(t) = targetX + (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * exp(timeDelta * ln((1 - speed)))

pow is probably more efficient than precalculated log if the speed is changed continuously but this might be rare enough.

parameters: TargetedRotationAngle + 90 + RotationAngleOffset + AngleDifference(CameraAngle(Object.Layer()), TargetedRotationAngle + 90 + RotationAngleOffset) * exp(TimeDelta() * RotationLogSpeed)
TargetedElevationAngle + ElevationAngleOffset + AngleDifference(90 - Scene3D::CameraRotationX(Object.Layer()), TargetedElevationAngle + ElevationAngleOffset) * exp(TimeDelta() * ElevationLogSpeed)

inlineCode: layer.setCameraX(object.getCenterXInScene() + localOffsetX * right.x + localOffsetY * forward.x + localOffsetZ * up.x);
layer.setCameraY(object.getCenterYInScene() + localOffsetX * right.y + localOffsetY * forward.y + localOffsetZ * up.y);
layer.setCameraZ(object.getCenterZInScene() + localOffsetX * right.z + localOffsetY * forward.z + localOffsetZ * up.z);

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: PANDAKO-GitHub
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: MousePointerLock
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This behavior removes the limit on the distance the mouse can move and hides the cursor.
description: This behavior removes the limit on the distance the mouse can move and hides the cursor.
For example, a user can rotate or continue to manipulate an object by moving the mouse endlessly ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://mouse-pointer-lock)).
Without the pointer lock, the rotation or operation will stop the moment the pointer reaches the edge of the browser or screen.
Game players don't have to worry about leaving the gameplay area or accidentally clicking on another application that moves the mouse focus away from the game.
Locking the pointer locks `CursorX()` and `CursorY()` expressions.
Use `MovementX()` and `MovementY()` instead.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: WaterShader
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A 3D plane with Wind Waker Ocean 2D shader
description: Original shader from:
https://www.shadertoy.com/view/ltfGD7

inlineCode: // Target the first selected object in the GDevelop event
// Get the core Three.js renderer instance from the GDevelop game object
// Get the current Three.js camera for uniform data
// Create the core water shader material
// Define constants for shader logic based on camera type
// Animation time uniform (must be updated every frame)
// Use object local X/Y coordinates as plane UVs for tiling
// Secondary, darker water color for texture mixing
return mix(a, b, u.x) + (c - a) * u.y * (1.0 - u.x) + (d - b) * u.x * u.y;
// Fractal Brownian Motion (FBM) for complex noise
// Function to generate a circle/spot mask
float circ(vec2 pos, vec2 c, float s) {
// Function to create the water texture layer
// Main function to sample the water texture and apply distortion/animation
// Initialize distortion vector. This is calculated separately from parallax.
// Time-based wave distortion using sine/cosine functions
// Mix the two water colors using the waterlayer mask
// Mix the result with the foam color based on an inverted, distorted layer
// Apply DUDV Distortion based on local plane UVs
* Helper function to apply the water material recursively to all meshes in the object.
// Store references on the mesh's userData for the per-frame update script
if (!mat) return; // Stop if no water material is attached
// Retrieve the 3D mesh from the object
// deltaTime in seconds for smooth animations
// Retrieve the GDevelop Custom Runtime Object
// Define the geometry for a plane. A size of 100x100 is used here.
// Define a basic material (cyan color) for the plane.
// side: THREE.DoubleSide ensures the plane is visible from both sides.
// Create the final Three.js mesh using the defined geometry and material
// Add the created Three.js mesh to the GDevelop object's 3D renderer.
// This makes the Three.js mesh visible and attached to the GDevelop object's position/rotation.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SpriteToggleSwitch
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Toggle switch that users can click or touch.
description: Toggle switch that users can click or touch. The switch can be customized with sprites.
There are ready-to-use toggle switches in the asset-store [settings UI pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=settings-ui-settings-ui).

changelog.breaking: - Toggle switches now use "variants", allowing easy swapping of their visual aspect. You will have to make some adjustments to existing toggle switches in your project. Follow this [migration documentation](https://wiki.gdevelop.io/gdevelop5/objects/custom-objects-prefab-template/migrate-to-variants/) to do these changes.
